text: the following report contains some
disturbing images
this is a place where animals are
supposed to be killed according to
strict religious rules but look how the
workers treat the Sheep they're thrown
around smashed against walls even
taunted with knives before they're
killed some of it is too upsetting to
show under the halal code they should
receive one single cut but the video
shows slaughterman hacking sheep
repeatedly this footage was filmed
secretly over three days in December by
animal aid a UK animal rights group I'm
shocked by the latest investigation but
I'm not surprised we've seen the same
kinds of abuse take place and several
other slaughterhouses and so while it's
always awful to see sheep being picked
up and beaten and thrown and so on that
really is something that everybody
should be shocked and disgusted about
these images from a halal abattoir which
unlike most doesn't stun animals before
they're killed is likely to reopen the
debate about religious slaughter
practices the Muslim Council of Britain
though has stressed that the findings
are abhorrent in Islamic practice and
the abattoir must be subject to the full
force of the law a report last week from
the Food Standards Agency suggested that
conditions in slaughterhouses had
dramatically improved in recent years
but after seeing how animals were being
treated here they've now launched an
investigation the slaughterhouse
management says it doesn't tolerate any
abuse of animals the abattoir continues
to maintain the very high standards they
always have done and in any business if
one person makes a mistake it's not the
end of the business it's very important
that a business deals with that properly
and that's exactly what's happened
one of these slaughterman has now been
dismissed the other three have had their
licenses suspended the Food Standards
Agency says it may take legal action
animal rights groups warned that abuse
is a much wider problem in
slaughterhouses of all kinds Dan Johnson
BBC News Thirsk
